RelatedSentence: Retired St. Louis businessman and philanthropist Eric Newman sold two coins at an auction in New York late last week for $ 1.41 million each .
In total , four sales of coins from Newman 's collection by Heritage Auctions of Dallas have brought in $ 44 million , the New York Times reports .
In total , four sales of coins from Newman 's collection by Heritage Auctions of Dallas have brought in $ 44 million , the New York Times reports .

Newman , who is 102 , has dedicated the proceeds from the sales to promoting the study of coins , including support for the Newman Money Museum he established at Washington University , his alma mater .

Newman , who is 102 , has dedicated the proceeds from the sales to promoting the study of coins , including support for the Newman Money Museum he established at Washington University , his alma mater .
In November , Newman sold a collection of nearly 2,000 rare American coins for $ 23 million during a two - day auction in New York City .
Newman previously told the Business Journal that his interest in coins dates back to when he was 7 years old and his grandfather gave him a one - cent piece dated 1859 .
